rule.name: Medium impact security : Violation of user-specified RISKY_CRYPTO policy
rule.description: A cryptographic function was used in such a way as to violate the user-specified RISKY_CRYPTO policy. This violation may indicate that an attacker could decrypt or otherwise interfere with the encrypted or hashed data.

rule.name: Medium impact security : Risky cryptographic hashing function
rule.description: A risky hashing function was used. This may allow an attacker to produce collisions on the hash or execute length extension attacks.

rule.name: Medium impact security : Risky cryptographic function
rule.description: A risky cryptographic function was used. This may allow an attacker to decrypt encrypted data as the quality of the cryptographic protection is suspect.

rule.name: Medium impact security : Risky cryptographic SSL protocol
rule.description: A Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) protocol was enabled that is known to be insecure. This may allow an attacker to decrypt or extract sensitive data that is transmitted over the network.

rule.name: Incorrect expression : Division or modulo by float zero
rule.description: An expression which may be zero is used as a divisor in floating-point arithmetic.

rule.name: Integer handling issues : Division or modulo by zero
rule.description: Division or modulo by zero results in an exception.

rule.name: Incorrect expression : Result is not floating-point
rule.description: When dividing two values of integer types, integer division is used, which ignores any remainder. When such a result is used in a context expecting a floating-point number, it is likely that floating-point division was intended.

rule.name: High impact security : Script code injection
rule.description: Script code interpreted or executed on the server is constructed from user-controllable data.

rule.name: Low impact security : Unknown language injection
rule.description: A user-controllable string is parsed using a parser generator that is used to create new languages or grammars.

rule.name: Medium impact security : Open redirect
rule.description: User-controlled input is used to specify an address that is used as a URL redirect or forward. An attacker can create a link to the trusted site that redirects to a malicious Web site. This could enable the attacker to steal user credentials.

rule.name: Low impact security : XML injection
rule.description: User-controllable data is parsed as XML.

rule.name: High impact security : Unsafe deserialization
rule.description: A user-controllable string is deserialized.

rule.name: Incorrect expression : Wrong kind of equality
rule.description: Using wrong equality operation (Equals or the equivalent method vs "==") for this type

rule.name: Incorrect expression : Wrong equality (referential)
rule.description: Using referential equality when value equality is the norm for this type

rule.name: Incorrect expression : Wrong equality (structural)
rule.description: Using Equals (or equivalent method) equality when "==" is the norm for this type

rule.name: Incorrect expression : Equality test on different types
rule.description: Structural equality is never true for objects of different types

rule.name: Resource leaks : Channel leak
rule.description: Leak of a channel object

rule.name: Resource leaks : Database connection leak
rule.description: Leak of a database connection

rule.name: Exceptional resource leaks : Resource leak on an exceptional path
rule.description: Leak of a system resource such as streams, channels, or other resources on an exception path (probably error handling)

rule.name: Resource leaks : Resource leak
rule.description: Leak of a system resource such as streams, channels, or other resources

rule.name: Resource leaks : Socket leak
rule.description: Leak of a socket resource

rule.name: Resource leaks : Stream leak
rule.description: Leak of a stream representing a file or other resource

rule.name: Concurrent data access violations : Data race condition
rule.description: Thread shared data is accessed without holding an appropriate lock, possibly causing a race condition

rule.name: Medium impact security : Unrestricted dispatch
rule.description: A user-controllable string is used as a view dispatch path.

rule.name: Class hierarchy inconsistencies : Missing call to base class
rule.description: Overrider does not call the base class method, even though most other overriders do

rule.name: Control flow issues : Stray semicolon
rule.description: The code contains a semicolon where it is probably not intended, such as between a 'for', 'while', 'if', or 'lock' and a code block.

rule.name: Low impact security : ASP.NET version disclosure
rule.description: The enableVersionHeader flag is set to true in the httpRuntime element.

rule.name: Coverity General CS
rule.description: Coverity General CS

rule.name: Low impact security : Cleartext sensitive data in a JAR file
rule.description: Reading sensitive data from a resource in the classpath.

rule.name: High impact security : Cleartext sensitive data in a cookie
rule.description: Reading unencrypted sensitive data from a cookie.

rule.name: Medium impact security : Cleartext sensitive data in a database
rule.description: Reading unencrypted sensitive data from a database.

rule.name: Low impact security : Cleartext sensitive data in a file
rule.description: Reading unencrypted sensitive data from a file.

rule.name: High impact security : Cleartext transmission of sensitive data
rule.description: Receiving sensitive data in cleartext from the network.

rule.name: High impact security : Missing encryption of sensitive data
rule.description: Retrieving or receiving unencrypted sensitive data.

rule.name: Medium impact security : NoSQL query injection
rule.description: A user-controllable string is injected into a NoSQL query.

rule.name: Medium impact security : Missing authorization check
rule.description: Calling a method that performs a sensitive action without first checking authorization, as is done elsewhere.

rule.name: Null pointer dereferences : Explicit null dereferenced
rule.description: Dereference of an explicit null value

rule.name: Null pointer dereferences : Explicit null dereferenced
rule.description: Dereference of an explicit null value

rule.name: Null pointer dereferences : Unchecked dynamic_cast
rule.description: Dynamic_cast may fail and return null if the type cast is incompatible

rule.name: Null pointer dereferences : Dereference after null check
rule.description: Reference is checked against null but then dereferenced anyway

rule.name: Null pointer dereferences : Unchecked "as" conversion
rule.description: The "as" conversion may fail and return null if the type cast is incompatible

rule.name: High impact security : LDAP injection
rule.description: A user-controllable string is injected into an LDAP query.

rule.name: Incorrect expression : Unused value
rule.description: A value assigned to a variable is never used.

rule.name: Code maintainability issues : Unused value
rule.description: A value assigned to a variable is never used.

rule.name: Low impact security : Missing HttpOnly in cookies
rule.description: Cookie data is vulnerable to cross-site scripting attacks, and sensitive information, such as session identifiers, could be leaked to a third party.

rule.name: Low impact security : ASP.NET MVC version header included
rule.description: MvcHandler.DisableMvcResponseHeader is not set to true in function Application_Start or its callees.

rule.name: Null pointer dereferences : Dereference before null check
rule.description: All paths that lead to this null pointer comparison already dereference the pointer earlier

rule.name: Incorrect expression : Copy-paste error
rule.description: A copied piece of code is inconsistent with the original

rule.name: Low impact security : Missing custom error page
rule.description: When a custom error page is not provided, ASP.NET displays detailed information about errors.

rule.name: Code maintainability issues : Indentation does not match nesting level
rule.description: The indentation of this code does not reflect its syntactic nesting level.

rule.name: Control flow issues : Nesting level does not match indentation
rule.description: The indentation of this code suggests it is nested when it is not.

rule.name: Incorrect expression : Useless call
rule.description: A function is called that is only useful for its return value, and this value is ignored.

rule.name: Coverity MSVSCA : Microsoft Visual Studio Code Analysis
rule.description: Coverity MSVSCA : Microsoft Visual Studio Code Analysis

rule.name: Concurrent data access violations : Volatile not atomically updated
rule.description: A volatile variable is updated in a non-atomic manner

rule.name: Concurrent data access violations : Volatile not atomically updated
rule.description: A volatile variable is updated in a non-atomic manner

rule.name: Concurrent data access violations : Volatile not atomically updated
rule.description: A volatile variable is updated in a non-atomic manner

rule.name: Concurrent data access violations : Volatile not atomically updated
rule.description: A volatile variable is updated in a non-atomic manner

rule.name: Integer handling issues : Unintentional integer overflow
rule.description: An integer overflow occurs, with the result converted to a wider integer type

rule.name: Medium impact security : Unrestricted entity expansion
rule.description: Passing tainted input data with possibly arbitrary entity references to a weakly configured XML parser that does not limit entity expansion.

rule.name: Medium impact security : Unrestricted external entity references
rule.description: Passing tainted input data with possibly arbitrary external entity references to a weakly configured XML parser.

rule.name: Medium impact security : Unrestricted document type definitions
rule.description: Passing tainted input data with possibly arbitrary DTDs to a weakly configured XML parser.

rule.name: Medium impact security : Unrestricted document type definitions
rule.description: Passing tainted input data with possibly arbitrary DTDs to a weakly configured XML parser.

rule.name: Integer handling issues : Bitwise-and with zero
rule.description: Bitwise-and ('&') operation applied to zero always produces zero

rule.name: Integer handling issues : Extra high-order bits
rule.description: In an operation, the high-order bits of wider operand do not affect the narrower operand

rule.name: Integer handling issues : Logical vs. bitwise operator
rule.description: Logical operator used in place of bitwise operator or vice versa

rule.name: Incorrect expression : Missing parentheses
rule.description: Missing parentheses caused unintended operator precedence

rule.name: Integer handling issues : Constant expression result
rule.description: An operation with non-constant operands that computes a result with constant value

rule.name: Integer handling issues : Wrong operator used
rule.description: Wrong operator used in expression

rule.name: Integer handling issues : Operands don't affect result
rule.description: An operation with non-constant operands that computes a result with constant value

rule.name: Incorrect expression : Same on both sides
rule.description: The same expression occurs on both sides of an operator.

rule.name: Integer handling issues : Suspicious &= or |=
rule.description: Using a bitwise assignment operator to assign a constant value

rule.name: Medium impact security : Use of hard-coded cryptographic key
rule.description: A cryptographic key is stored directly in the source code.

rule.name: Medium impact security : Use of hard-coded password
rule.description: A password is stored directly in the source code.

rule.name: Medium impact security : Use of hard-coded security token
rule.description: A security token is stored directly in the source code.

rule.name: Medium impact security : Use of hard-coded credentials
rule.description: Credentials are stored directly in the source code

rule.name: Medium impact security : Use of hard-coded connection string password
rule.description: A connection string password is stored directly in the source code.

rule.name: Program hangs : Thread deadlock
rule.description: Threads may try to acquire two locks in different orders, potentially causing deadlock

rule.name: High impact security : Cross-site scripting
rule.description: Untrusted user-supplied data is inserted into a context that can execute JavaScript without adequate validation, escaping, or filtering

rule.name: High impact security : Cross-site scripting (stored)
rule.description: Untrusted user-supplied data is stored in a database and subsequently read back and included in a context that can execute JavaScript without adequate validation, escaping, or filtering

rule.name: High impact security : Cross-site request forgery
rule.description: The web application controller modifies data or state and is unprotected from cross-site request forgery.

rule.name: Medium impact security : Cross-site request forgery
rule.description: The web application controller modifies data or state and is unprotected from cross-site request forgery.

rule.name: High impact security : Cross-site request forgery
rule.description: The web application controller modifies data or state and is unprotected from cross-site request forgery.

rule.name: Integer handling issues : Bad bit shift operation
rule.description: A bit shift operation has a shift amount which is too large or has a negative value.

rule.name: Low impact security : Disabled View State MAC generation
rule.description: View State Machine Authentication Code (MAC) generation was disabled

rule.name: Program hangs : Infinite loop
rule.description: Infinite loop with no exit condition

rule.name: Program hangs : Infinite loop
rule.description: Infinite loop with unsatisfiable exit condition

rule.name: Medium impact security : Dead Deny Rule
rule.description: A deny rule has no effect

rule.name: Low impact security : Dead Allow Rule
rule.description: An allow rule has no effect

rule.name: Low impact security : Dead Allow Rule
rule.description: An allow rule has no effect

rule.name: Microsoft: Miscellaneous : MS Code Analysis warning
rule.description: Unclassified warning from Microsoft Code Analysis

rule.name: High impact security : OS Command Injection
rule.description: Untrusted user-supplied data is inserted into an operating system command without adequate validation, escaping, or filtering. This inserted data can change the intent of the operating system command. The change to the operating system command may result in the unauthorized disclosure, destruction, or modification of sensitive data or operating system resources.

rule.name: High impact security : OS Command Injection
rule.description: Untrusted user-supplied data is inserted into an operating system command without adequate validation, escaping, or filtering. This inserted data can change the intent of the operating system command. The change to the operating system command may result in the unauthorized disclosure, destruction, or modification of sensitive data or operating system resources.

rule.name: High impact security : OS Command Injection
rule.description: Untrusted user-supplied data is inserted into an operating system command without adequate validation, escaping, or filtering. This inserted data can change the intent of the operating system command. The change to the operating system command may result in the unauthorized disclosure, destruction, or modification of sensitive data or operating system resources.

rule.name: High impact security : Weak password hashing
rule.description: Hashing a password using a scheme that is not computationally intensive, and/or without using a random and unique salt as part of the input.

rule.name: Medium impact security : Hashing a password with a weak hash function
rule.description: Hashing a password using a scheme that is not computationally intensive.

rule.name: High impact security : Very weak password hashing
rule.description: Hashing a password using a scheme that is not computationally intensive, and without using any salt as part of the input.

rule.name: High impact security : Weak password hashing
rule.description: Hashing a password using a scheme that is not computationally intensive, and without using a random and unique salt as part of the input.

rule.name: Low impact security : Hashing a password with a weak salt
rule.description: Hashing a password without using a random and unique salt as part of the input.

rule.name: High impact security : Filesystem path, filename, or URI manipulation
rule.description: A user-controllable string is used as part or all of a filesystem path, filename, or URI (uniform resource identifier).

rule.name: Incorrect expression : Identical code for different cases
rule.description: The same code is executed for two cases in the same switch statement

rule.name: Incorrect expression : Identical code for different branches of an else-if chain
rule.description: The same code is executed regardless of the condition

rule.name: Incorrect expression : Identical code for different branches
rule.description: The same code is executed regardless of the condition

rule.name: Incorrect expression : Identical code for different branches
rule.description: The same code is executed regardless of the condition

rule.name: Incorrect expression : Identical code for different branches
rule.description: The same code is executed regardless of the condition

rule.name: Low impact security : Unencrypted connection string password
rule.description: A configuration file connection string includes a plaintext password.

rule.name: Error handling issues : Exception not thrown
rule.description: An object of exception type is created but neither thrown nor stored anywhere; the developer likely intended to throw the exception.

rule.name: Concurrent data access violations : Value not atomically updated
rule.description: Critical section does not protect read-update-write of a concurrently shared value

rule.name: Control flow issues : Failure to restore non-local value
rule.description: Handles classes of flow where a function is either saving some external value, modifying the external value, and then clearly intending to restore it to its original state but failing to do so along one of many paths; or else is checking whether an external has some expected value, modifying the external value, then clearly intending to restore it to the expected value but failing to do so along a path.

rule.name: Control flow issues : Failure to restore non-local value
rule.description: Handles classes of flow where a function is either saving some external value, modifying the external value, and then clearly intending to restore it to its original state but failing to do so along one of many paths; or else is checking whether an external has some expected value, modifying the external value, then clearly intending to restore it to the expected value but failing to do so along a path.

rule.name: Possible Control flow issues : Possible failure to restore non-local value
rule.description: Handles classes of flow where a function is either saving some external value, modifying the external value, and then possibly intending to restore it to its original state but not doing so along one of many paths; or else is checking whether an external has some expected value, modifying the external value, then possibly intending to restore it to the expected value but not doing so along a path. Such code is only incorrect if the intent really was to restore along all paths.

rule.name: Medium impact security : Exception leaked to user interface
rule.description: Displaying an exception message or stack trace in the user interface.

rule.name: High impact security : Cleartext sensitive data in a cookie
rule.description: Storing unencrypted sensitive data in a cookie.

rule.name: Medium impact security : Cleartext sensitive data in a database
rule.description: Storing unencrypted sensitive data to a database.

rule.name: Low impact security : Cleartext sensitive data in a file
rule.description: Storing unencrypted sensitive data to a file.

rule.name: High impact security : Display of sensitive data in the user interface
rule.description: Displaying sensitive data in the user interface.

rule.name: Low impact security : Information exposure to log file
rule.description: Logging sensitive data.

rule.name: Medium impact security : Cleartext sensitive data in the registry
rule.description: Storing unencrypted sensitive data in the system registry.

rule.name: High impact security : Cleartext transmission of sensitive data
rule.description: Transmitting sensitive data in cleartext.

rule.name: High impact security : Leak of sensitive data
rule.description: Sensitive data is stored or transmitted without encrypting it

rule.name: Concurrent data access violations : Data race condition
rule.description: Static field is protected by a per-instance lock

rule.name: Low impact security : Trace mode enabled
rule.description: ASP.NET trace mode is enabled.

rule.name: Null pointer dereferences : Dereference null return value
rule.description: Return value of function which returns null is dereferenced without checking

rule.name: Null pointer dereferences : Dereference null return (stat)
rule.description: Return value of function, which is statistically inferred to return null, but with no source code available, is dereferenced

rule.name: Medium impact security : XML Path (XPath) Language injection
rule.description: A user-controllable string is injected into an XPath query.

rule.name: Medium impact security : HTTP header injection
rule.description: A user-controllable string is used to construct an HTTP header name.

rule.name: API usage errors : Arguments in wrong order
rule.description: The arguments to a function call are provided in the wrong order.

rule.name: Low impact security : Debug mode enabled
rule.description: ASP.NET debug mode is enabled.

rule.name: Unreliable locking behavior : Bad choice of lock object
rule.description: Using a boxed primitive as a lock may cause different locking behavior in different versions of the Java VM. locking behavior. It can also cause deadlocks or performance problems if a library also uses the boxed primitive as a lock.

rule.name: Concurrent data access violations : Bad choice of lock object
rule.description: Using an interned string as a lock may cause deadlocks or performance problems if a library also uses the interned string as a lock.

rule.name: Concurrent data access violations : Bad choice of lock object
rule.description: Locking upon an object which is a poor choice due to too broad, too narrow, or too unpredictable aliasing behavior.

rule.name: Unreliable locking behavior : Bad choice of lock object
rule.description: Using an object which is only accessible to a single thread as a lock provides no protection against race conditions.

rule.name: Unreliable locking behavior : Bad choice of lock object
rule.description: The field used as a lock can be assigned a different value while the critical section is operating. This can cause multiple threads to enter the critical section at the same time, which may cause nondeterministic behavior.

rule.name: Possible Control flow issues : Dead case in switch
rule.description: Switch never goes directly to this case

rule.name: Possible Control flow issues : Dead default in switch
rule.description: Default in switch statement is dead code

rule.name: Possible Control flow issues : 'Constant' variable guards dead code
rule.description: Variable assigned once to a constant guards dead code.

rule.name: Control flow issues : Logically dead code
rule.description: Code can never be reached because of a logical contradiction

rule.name: Possible Control flow issues : Redundant test
rule.description: Test always evaluates the same

rule.name: Low impact security : Regular expression injection
rule.description: A regular expression is constructed from a user-controllable string.

rule.name: Insecure random category : Insecure random value used in security context
rule.description: Random value generated using a cryptographically insecure pseudo-random number generator, and used in a security-sensitive context

rule.name: Insecure random category : Cryptographically weak PRNG
rule.description: Random value generated using a cryptographically insecure pseudo-random number generator

rule.name: Insecure random category : Cryptographically weak PRNG
rule.description: Random value generated using a cryptographically insecure pseudo-random number generator

rule.name: High impact security : SQL injection
rule.description: Untrusted user-supplied data is inserted into a SQL statement without adequate validation, escaping, or filtering

rule.name: Medium impact security : SQL injection
rule.description: Untrusted user-supplied data is inserted into an apparent SQL statement without adequate validation, escaping, or filtering

rule.name: High impact security : SQL injection
rule.description: Untrusted user-supplied data is inserted into a SQL statement without adequate validation, escaping, or filtering

rule.name: Data race undermines locking : Check of thread-shared field evades lock acquisition
rule.description: Checking the value of a thread-shared field outside of a locked region to determine if a locked operation involving that thread shared field has completed.

rule.name: High impact security : Untainted assertion violation
rule.description: A user assertion is present that states a value is not tainted. However, the tool taint computation indicates that this value is tainted. The validity of the assertion should be reviewed and removed if incorrect. If the assertion is valid, review how tainted data is inserted into the value and remove the taint source as appropriate.

rule.name: Control flow issues : Structurally dead code
rule.description: Code block is unreachable because of the syntactic structure of the code
